channel.title: [Bots] Breaking or not breaking? [/Bots]
channel.description:
What's your opinion? I've heard many people say that if you don't make the bot take breaks, there's less of a chance to get caught. But if this were true, why would bots like RSBot still have that option available?
[size=18pt][u][b]DISCUSS[/b][/u][/size]

item.title: [Bots] Breaking or not breaking? [/Bots]
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:5, topic:397323”]The practice of developing a bot is trying to make it act as “human” as possible. And being human comes with certain constraints. For example, we have to eat, we have to sleep, we have to go to the bathroom. Now, we can change our behavior to reduce the frequency, and method at which we do these things (ie. keeping your water intake and salt intake similar to reduce the frequency you go to the bathroom. And in extreme cases, inserting a catheter so you don’t have to get up). You can alter your sleep schedule so that you can stay up for a longer period of time, and have people bring food to you, but the chances of doing all of that is slim.

There have been studies that after a few days without REM sleep, the subjects started hallucinating, and any more time after that there brain simply couldn’t handle it anymore and died.

So the most likely outcome is that Jagex checks the last time they were idle, determines the probability that it’s a human or bot, and goes with their best guess.

If you had a bot running for 1 week without any breaks, then it would be very likely that it’s not a human playing.[/quote]
yes, and you’d get soo much REM rebound it’d suck

Read full topic

item.title: [Bots] Breaking or not breaking? [/Bots]
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

If there is any truth to this the act of removing breaking from popular free bots would take away the idea that breaking makes you get banned easier because then Jagex would know that the majority of botting sites don’t use breaks. What a conundrum.

Read full topic

item.title: [Bots] Breaking or not breaking? [/Bots]
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Just finished 99 dung doing 24 hours on 3 hours off.
But dung isn’t as easy to catch(less players to report, no randoms)

Doing FM now, and I really have to take breaks.

Read full topic

item.title: [Bots] Breaking or not breaking? [/Bots]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

The practice of developing a bot is trying to make it act as “human” as possible. And being human comes with certain constraints. For example, we have to eat, we have to sleep, we have to go to the bathroom. Now, we can change our behavior to reduce the frequency, and method at which we do these things (ie. keeping your water intake and salt intake similar to reduce the frequency you go to the bathroom. And in extreme cases, inserting a catheter so you don’t have to get up). You can alter your sleep schedule so that you can stay up for a longer period of time, and have people bring food to you, but the chances of doing all of that is slim.

There have been studies that after a few days without REM sleep, the subjects started hallucinating, and any more time after that there brain simply couldn’t handle it anymore and died.

So the most likely outcome is that Jagex checks the last time they were idle, determines the probability that it’s a human or bot, and goes with their best guess.

If you had a bot running for 1 week without any breaks, then it would be very likely that it’s not a human playing.

Read full topic

item.title: [Bots] Breaking or not breaking? [/Bots]
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

Never knew that was possibe, although I haven’t botted in a while…

Since that is possible, I recommend doing that. But still, don’t leave your account logged in for outrageous amounts of time each day.

Read full topic

item.title: [Bots] Breaking or not breaking? [/Bots]
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

you can set a break timer if you wish, just at random non-repeating intervals

Read full topic

item.title: [Bots] Breaking or not breaking? [/Bots]
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

To get you banned as soon as possible because they do not care about they’re customers and only want their money.

But my opinion is, you shouldn’t bot more than you sit at your computer; in this case, you do not need breaks and you seem like a real player.

You know how people say botting Soul Wars is a easy way to get banned? I went there for 2 months, botting, but instead of leaving my bot on all the time, I just ran it when I was on my computer. Got 99 hp from it.

So basically what I’m trying to say is, you need to seem realistic. Don’t bot long enough that you have to set a break timer, etc. It’s fairly easy to get caught nowadays if you don’t know what your doing.

Read full topic
